Channel 157 (HD) }} '''Disney Channel Malaysia''' is a [[Disney Channel (international)|Disney Channel]]-branded pay cable television channel for viewers in [[Malaysia]] and [[Brunei]] based in [[Klang Valley]] (surrounding area in [[Kuala Lumpur]] (a national capital of Malaysia)) and [[Brunei-Muara District|Brunei-Muara]] (surrounding area in [[Bandar Seri Begawan]] (national capital of Brunei)) and is available in three languages: [[Malaysian English|English]], [[Malaysian language|Bahasa Malaysia]] and [[Mandarin language|Mandarin]]. This channel is only available on [[Astro (Malaysian satellite television)|Astro]] on Channel 615 and Channel 635. The old name for Disney Channel Malaysia was [[Disney Channel Asia]]. Malaysian English, Bahasa Malaysia and Mandarin are available 24 hours daily. Disney Channel Malaysia's main competitors are [[Nickelodeon (Malaysia)|Nickelodeon Malaysia]] and [[Cartoon Network (Southeast Asia)|Cartoon Network Malaysia]]. [[Justin Bieber]] was the ambassador for Disney Channel Malaysia. ==History== ===Launch=== Disney Channel Malaysia was grand opened and grand launched inaugurated officially established started began [[sign-on]] television broadcasting air date on air{{What|date=September 2011|reason=run-on}} at midnight at 00:00 or 12:00 am ([[UTC+08:00]] â [[Time in Malaysia|Kuala Lumpur Standard Time]]) on [[New Year's Day|Tuesday, 1 January 2008]], broadcasting from a newly opened playout centre managed by [[Bernama|Berita Nasional Malaysia (Bernama)]], a subsidiary company co-owned by [[Astro (Malaysian satellite television)|Astro]] from facilities on [[Suria KLCC]] made in [[Petronas Towers|Pretonas Twin Towers]] based in [[Kuala Lumpur]] (national capital of [[Malaysia]]). At the stroke of midnight, following [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]]'s ''Into The New Year'' bulletin featuring the [[Sultan Abdul Samad Building]] clock tower bell chimes, technicians at the [[Klang Valley]] transmitter switched from [[Angkasapuri]] to the [[Radio Televisyen Malaysia]] playout centre from where Carlton went on-air with an opening ident featuring the then first announcement from continuity announcer [[w:id:Mikha Tambayong|Mikha Tambayong]] was the ambassador, chief of exclusive officer chairman, main director secretariat general, head of state, president, governor, mayorcity and municipality for [[Disney Channel Malaysia]]. He started the first continuity announcement for Disney Channel Malaysia with these words: "And a Happy new year. Welcome to 2008, and our first programme live from [[Bukit Bintang]], here's [[w:id:Teuku Wisnu|Teuku Wisnu]] with a Disney Channel Malaysia New Year". The station's first programme was the entertainment special ''A [[Disney Channel Malaysia]] New Year'', produced in-house and presented by Teuku Wisnu. ==Public Holiday== {{Main|Public holidays in Malaysia}} ===[[New Year's Eve]]=== A government-held [[New Year's Eve]] countdown known as '''Ambang Tahun Baru''' will be held at [[Dataran Merdeka|Merdeka Square]], the field opposite the [[Sultan Abdul Samad Building]] in the [[Malaysia]]n capital of [[Kuala Lumpur]]. The event will be broadcast live on government as well as public government state-media radio and television broadcasting stations arm [[Radio Televisyen Malaysia]]. Besides the governmental event in [[Dataran Merdeka|Merdeka Square]], private organizations too hold their own New Year countdown parties at major shopping malls and landmarks, most notably the fireworks display at the [[Petronas Towers|Pretonas Twin Towers]] and [[Kuala Lumpur Tower]] things fireworks from [[Bukit Bintang]] located at [[Jalan Bukit Bintang]]. ===[[Christmas Eve]]=== {{Main|Christianity in Malaysia#Christmas}} Although [[Christmas]] is a [[Public holidays in Malaysia|public holiday in Malaysia]] much of the public celebration is commercial in nature and has no overt religious overtones. Occasionally, [[Christianity in Malaysia|Christian]] activist groups do buy newspaper advertorials on [[Christmas]] or [[Easter]] but this is largely only allowed in [[Malaysian English]] newspapers and permission is not given every year. The advertorials themselves are usually indirect statements. There has been controversy over whether or not the national government has exerted pressure on [[Christianity in Malaysia|Malaysian Christians]] not to use [[Christianity in Malaysia|Christian]] religious symbols and hymns that specifically mention [[Jesus Christ]]. == Availability == === Malaysia === *[[Astro (Malaysian satellite television)|Astro]] (Channel 615 and Channel 635) === Brunei === *[[Kristal-Astro|Kristal Astro]] (Channel 615 and Channel 635) ==Programmes== # '''[[Upin & Ipin]]''' # '''[[Waktu Rehat]]''' # [[Even Stevens]] # [[Lizzie McGuire]] # [[That's So Raven]] # [[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]] # [[Hannah Montana]] # [[Cory in the House]] # [[Wizards of Waverly Place]] # [[The Suite Life on Deck]] # [[Sonny With A Chance]] # [[Jonas L.A.]] # [[Good Luck Charlie]] # [[Shaun the Sheep]] # [[Shaolin Wuzang]] # [[Donald Duck Presents]] # [[The Replacements (TV series)|The Replacements]] # [[American Dragon: Jake Long]] # [[Kim Possible]] # [[System Maintenance - Dc Asia]] # [[Good Morning, Mickey!]] # [[Mickey Mouse Works]] # [[House of Mouse]] # [[Phineas and Ferb]] # [[Get Ed]] # [[Mr. Bean]] ## [[Mr. Bean|Mr. Bean - Live Action Series]] ## [[Mr. Bean (animated TV series)|Mr. Bean]] (animated version) # [[Totally Spies!]] # [[The Amazing Spiez!]] # [[Pucca]] # [[Yin Yang Yo!]] # [[Totally Spies!]] # [[Lilo & Stitch: The Series]] ===Movies=== ====[[List of Disney Channel Original Movies|Disney Channel Original Movies]]==== =====Movies===== {| class="wikitable" |- | colspan="2" style="background:#99CCCC; text-align:center;"| '''2006''' |- !
